arlut.csd.JDataComponent
Class JMultiLineLabel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.text.JTextComponent
                  javax.swing.JTextArea
                      arlut.csd.JDataComponent.JMultiLineLabel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable
public class JMultiLineLabel
extends javax.swing.JTextArea

A simple word-wrapping multiline label. Actually implemented as a JTextArea, as that Swing class has built-in support for the word wrapping.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

columns

int columns
Controls the default word wrap length. The default value of 128 columns should hopefully be wide enough to handle exception traces gracefully.

allowCopyPaste

private boolean allowCopyPaste
If true, we'll let ourselves be focused, which enables copy and paste.

wrap

public java.lang.String wrap(java.lang.String text)
Local convenience method to wrap the String provided to the number of columns last set by arlut.csd.JDataComponent. If no call to setWrapLength() has been made, the wrap length defaults to 128 characters.

isFocusable

public boolean isFocusable()

We're pretending to be a label, so please don't give us focus.

Overrides:
isFocusable in class java.awt.Component

getLongestLineWidth

private int getLongestLineWidth(java.lang.String wrappedText)

This function is designed to return the number of pixels wide this JMultiLineLabel needs to be in order to fit all the lines if they are wrapped by the WordWrap algorithm at the fixed wrap length set for this JMultiLineLabel.

In theory, this should be enough for getPreferredSize() to give us the elbow room we need, but for some reason that doesn't seem to be happening properly when we are used in StringDialog.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
